name: No-Cook Shrimp Dragon Boats

ingredients.name: Sweet & Spicy Organic Mustard or Dijon-style mustard
Creamy Potato Salad Dressing Mix or Lemon Dilly Dip Mix

preparation: In a large bowl, stir together mayonnaise, mustard and dressing mix. Portion half into a Prep Bowl; stir in water or milk to make a thin dressing. Set aside.
Pull off and discard shrimp tails, if you wish. Cut shrimps in half or thirds; add to large bowl; toss to evenly coat with mayo mixture.
Spoon shrimp mixture into lettuce leaves (use 2 leaves per boat); top with avocado and pepper. Arrange on plates; drizzle with reserved dressing (from Prep Bowl). Add toppings, if desired.
tips: Swap shrimp for leftover cooked chicken.

products.name: Sweet & Spicy Organic Mustard
summary: Golden, sweet, with just the right heat. You’ll love this on burgers and Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwiches—or as a dip for chicken fingers. It’s also amazing in potato salad and salad dressings.

products.name: Creamy Potato Salad Dressing Mix
summary: The ultimate summer salad, just add a few simple ingredients to make the most delish potato salad with notes of dill and a hint of sweetness. Each jar makes 6 cups of creamy or vinaigrette-style dressing so you can easily feed a crowd at a backyard barbecue.

products.name: Lemon Dilly Dip Mix
summary: Beyond being one of our most-loved kid-friendly dips – they love it for dunking chicken strips, fish bites, and veggies – Lemon Dilly is all about versatility. With loads of dill and a hint of lemon zest, it makes an utterly delicious tzatziki and spread for burgers and sandwiches, and levels up everything from salad dressing and salmon to pasta and vegetables.
